item.title: A WORKING Special Bar for your Site (pics + example)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Here’s something I wrote up. Everything is self-contained, and loading is instantaneous.

http://sneamia.net/junk/specialbar/

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8" />
<title>Special Bar Lol</title>
<style type="text/css">
div#specialbar {
	height:30px;
	width:152px;
	overflow:hidden;
	position:relative;
}

div#specialbar img {
	position:relative;
}
</style>
<script type="text/javascript">
function shiftdown() {
	newHeight = parseInt(specialBar.style.top.replace('px')) - 30;
	if (specialBar.height + newHeight == 0) {
		alert('Reset.');
		specialBar.style.top = '0px';
	} else {
		specialBar.style.top = newHeight + 'px';
	}
}
function loader() {
	specialBar = document.getElementById('specialbar').childNodes[0];
	document.getElementById('specialbar').childNodes[0].onclick = shiftdown;
}
</script>
</head>

<body onload="loader();">
	<div id="specialbar"><img src="specialbar.png" alt="SPECIAL ATTACK" style="top:0px;"/></div>
</body>
</html>

Read full topic

item.title: A WORKING Special Bar for your Site (pics + example)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Yet again, ive decided to write this tut after practicing it with special bars I had drawn with paint, feel free to do so, but theese are the REAL special bars from runescape taken on the 26th of october, this tutorial will not show you how to create your own special bars on paint, though if you think you know how then by all means, go ahead.
Also this is still only my third tutorial on web design and I love praise and as promised there is pictures along with this tutorial and an example of a website containing a runescape special bar in a RAR file.
UPDATE: xxlegitxx’s way of doing this has now been added at the bottom and a link to what it does.
[hr]
EXAMPLE OF WHAT THIS DOES EXACTLY: My special bar page!
[hr]
Requirements: winRAR or 7zip , just a program that can extract .RAR archives.
Assumed Knowledge: Actually I think this guide explains everything pretty well, so if you not that smart, thats perfectly ok
[hr]
STEP 1: Downloading the package from tobiasscape.com
Ok, basically download the small RAR file below: http://www.tobiasscape.com/HTML_special_bar.rar
Download it to your desktop, then extract the files. (Or right click the RAR file and click “Extract Here”)
Take a look inside the extracted folder, there should be 7 bmp images and one html file.

STEP 2: Looking at the code
Now a good tutorial always looks at the code and talks the person through it.
Right click index.htm and click “Edit”. That should come up in notepad… Dont worry if it dosent thats perfectly O.K any old text editer will do.
as you probably already know, there are four basic parts to a blank HTML document;

Now as far as I know a HTML document has to have theese in order to work properly.
lets take a look at the entire HTML coding of our index.htm:

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>A Real Special Bar Handler by Tobias</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY>
<h1>A Basic Special Bar by Tobias!</h1><br>
<img src="100full.bmp" name="special_bar" onClick="specialHandler();">
<script type="text/javascript">
//***[START OF TOBIAS'S SPECIAL HANDLER]***

var timesClicked = 0; //letting the document know the initial value of timesClicked

//HOW IT WORKS:
//the function (known as method, or void in java) below uses decision making
//statements to decide how many times the user has clicked the special bar,
//as you can see, every time someone clicks the image, the function specialHandler()
//gets called, and it puts timesClicked up by one every time it is called, and the 
//function then checks what number timesClicked is equal to so it knows which image to
//display in the document

 function specialHandler(){ // start of a very important function...
timesClicked += 1;
if(timesClicked == 1){
window.document.special_bar.src="73full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 2){
//50%
window.document.special_bar.src="50full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 3){
//36%
window.document.special_bar.src="36full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 4){
window.document.special_bar.src="25full.bmp";
//25%
} else if(timesClicked == 4){
window.document.special_bar.src="15full.bmp";
//15%
} else if(timesClicked == 5){
//0%
window.document.special_bar.src="0full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked >= 6){
//0% clicked again
alert("You dont have any special left!");
}
}//end of the function

//***[END OF SPECIAL HANDLER BY TOBIAS]***
</script>

</BODY>
</HTML>

Yes, that is our entire index.htm, Relax, its not as hard to understand as it may seem at first:
Basically, the first few lines (from to ) do hardly anything apart from declaring the title. And that is done in between and
Then from to Is where all the content goes, and also possibly a script or two. Even an applet, but well not worry ourselves with that now. Lets look at the skeleton of our :

<BODY>
<script type="text/javascript">
</script>
</BODY>

Ignore everything for a minute, concentrate on this, sign out of msn, log off RuneScape, turn your complete attention to this screen. Ignore all the fancy code inbetween the tags and concentrate on the skeleton of the Study it and try t o understand it.
Now, the without the tags in it:

<BODY>
<h1> TEXT GOES HERE TO DISPLAY </h1>
<img>
</BODY>

Now just incase you didnt realise, thats what the skeleton of the tag looks like, without the src="" and the name="" and onClick="". They are just events triggered when that thing happens, for instance, the image below would create an alert box when the mouse moves over it!:

<img src="some_path.bmp" onMouseOver="alert('Mouse over the image!');">

So, I hope you now understand the

, the and the basic skeleton for a HTML file.

STEP 3: Understanding the
Ok, once again I require your full attention. This bit is the hardest part of the whole tutorial (if your not just c+p ’ ing it…) The main point of this tutorial is to teach, to entertain and to expand ideas. So please just take it seriously…
First of all, lets look and see whats in the actual tag shall we?

<script type="text/javascript>
</script>

That is the skeleton for a script in a webpage, scripts can either go in the and the for some reason, however, I just prefer to use BODY because thats where the content goes.
* In some cases, putting too much script in the can lag the site, so if you have a big site, i’d recommend just using the
type=“SOME SCRIPT TYPE” = The language your using basically.
Now, we move on…
var someVariableName = itsValue; = Declaring a variable…
You probably know, in JAVA there is many different types of Variables,
long, string, int, boolean … but the handy thing about JavaScript is there is only one type,
and that starts off with var … = …; For the timesClicked variable, I used the integear type, and
kept it a number with this code:

var timesClicked = 0;

and please note:
ANY LINE IN JAVASCRIPT THAT STARTS WITH // , IS A COMMENT!
And you can see, I’ve commented my code a lot to explain how it works!
PART 3: The Function…
I put this in its own step because its sort of the final bit to learn, and I wanted to decorate it sortof… lol … Well please concentrate on this as it is very important. You learned earlier in this tutorial that the code below calles specialHandler(); into action when it is clicked:

<img src="some_src.bmp" onClick="specialHandler();">

Lets look at the function specialHandler() , shall we?

 function specialHandler(){ // start of a very important function...
timesClicked += 1;
if(timesClicked == 1){
window.document.special_bar.src="73full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 2){
//50%
window.document.special_bar.src="50full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 3){
//36%
window.document.special_bar.src="36full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked == 4){
window.document.special_bar.src="25full.bmp";
//25%
} else if(timesClicked == 4){
window.document.special_bar.src="15full.bmp";
//15%
} else if(timesClicked == 5){
//0%
window.document.special_bar.src="0full.bmp";
} else if(timesClicked >= 6){
//0% clicked again
alert("You dont have any special left!");
}
}//end of the function

Now, just incase thats not completley self-explainatory, Heres an explaination:
First of all, theres the start of the function is specialHandler(){ , and the end
of the function is } . Then theres timesClicked += 1; , which puts
the timesClicked variable up by one every time its clicked. Then the decision making
bit, it starts with if(tomesClicked == 1){ and ends with }. Anything you put in between the { and } happens if timesClicked is equal to one. Look at the == . You must be thinking there are other questions to ask, surely? but you dont know how to. Below is a list of signs you can put there and what they mean:
>= Is bigger than OR equal to
<= Is smaller than OR equal to (im almost sure, please correct me )
!= Is not equal to
== Is equal to
Now well look at the else if(something == something_else){ after the }.
This just means “Or else, if it is equal to 2 then {” and this happens over and over… as many times as you like, but must always end with a } (with no else after it)
[hr]
[hr]
[hr]
[hr]
XXLEGITXX Posted this and gave me permission to use it in this post.
Ok, his isn’t very well explained, but is a different way altogether of doing this.
[hr]
EXAMPLE OF WHAT THIS DOES (on webpage): http://sneamia.net/junk/specialbar/
[hr]
I just included this to show you that mine isn’t the only way of doing this and there are (mabye) far more effective ways.
(I said “maybe” because it depends on how you prefer to do things.)
Ok , he gave me this src :

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8" />
<title>Special Bar Lol</title>
<style type="text/css">
div#specialbar {
	height:30px;
	width:152px;
	overflow:hidden;
	position:relative;
}

div#specialbar img {
	position:relative;
}
</style>
<script type="text/javascript">
function shiftdown() {
	newHeight = parseInt(specialBar.style.top.replace('px')) - 30;
	if (specialBar.height + newHeight == 0) {
		alert('Reset.');
		specialBar.style.top = '0px';
	} else {
		specialBar.style.top = newHeight + 'px';
	}
}
function loader() {
	specialBar = document.getElementById('specialbar').childNodes[0];
	document.getElementById('specialbar').childNodes[0].onclick = shiftdown;
}
</script>
</head>

<body onload="loader();">
	<div id="specialbar"><img src="specialbar.png" alt="SPECIAL ATTACK" style="top:0px;"/></div>
</body>
</html>

[hr]
Im glad I got that finished this morning! lol please reply if you use or reply your view of it. Thanks, tobias222

Read full topic
